Property.val: Total Tumor Size (size of entire tumor)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41829
DisplayedItem.title: # Note: The size of the entire tumor (total tumor size) applies to all tumors and includes the invasive component and the nonmucinous lepidic component of adenocarcinomas.

Question.name: Q_41688
Question.title: ?Size of Invasive Component## (required only if invasive nonmucinous adenocarcinomas with lepidic component is present)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41703
DisplayedItem.title: ## Note: The size of the invasive component applies only to invasive nonmucinous adenocarcinomas with lepidic component. For all tumor types other than invasive nonmucinous adenocarcinoma with lepidic component, invasive tumor size equals total tumor size.

Section.name: S_1739
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note J)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59520
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_59520_1
Property.val: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_43572
DisplayedItem.title: # Note: The suffix m (or a specific number) should only be used in the setting of multifocal ground-glass / lepidic nodules that histologically present as adenocarcinomas with prominent lepidic component. Multiple primary lung cancers showing different histologic type or different morphology based on comprehensive histologic subtyping are staged as independent tumors without m suffix.

ListItem.name: LI_1741
ListItem.title: pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed, or tumor proven by presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy

ListItem.name: LI_1742
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_40209
ListItem.title: pTis (SCIS): Squamous cell carcinoma in situ (SCIS)

ListItem.name: LI_53855
ListItem.title: pTis (AIS): Adenocarcinoma in situ (AIS): adenocarcinoma with pure lepidic pattern, <= 3 cm in greatest dimension

DisplayedItem.name: DI_43216
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor <= 3 cm in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura, without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus)

ListItem.name: LI_53734
ListItem.title: pT1mi: Minimally invasive adenocarcinoma: adenocarcinoma (<= 3 cm in greatest dimension) with a predominantly lepidic pattern and <= 5 mm invasion in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_51616
ListItem.title: pT1a: Tumor <= 1 cm in greatest dimension. A superficial, spreading tumor of any size whose invasive component is limited to the bronchial wall and may extend proximal to the main bronchus also is classified as T1a, but these tumors are uncommon

ListItem.name: LI_44477
ListItem.title: pT1b: Tumor > 1 cm but <= 2 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_42081
ListItem.title: pT1c: Tumor > 2 cm but <= 3 cm in greatest dimension

DisplayedItem.name: DI_35831
DisplayedItem.title: pT2: Tumor > 3 cm but <= 5 cm or having any of the following features: Involves the main bronchus regardless of distance to the carina, but without involvement of the carina; OR Invades visceral pleura (PL1 or PL2); OR Associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis that extends to the hilar region, involving part or all of the lung

DisplayedItem.name: DI_54962
DisplayedItem.title: Note: T2 tumors with these features are classified as T2a if <= 4 cm or if the size cannot be determined and T2b if > 4 cm but <= 5 cm.

ListItem.name: LI_54487
ListItem.title: pT2a: Tumor > 3 cm, but <= 4 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_46349
ListItem.title: pT2b: Tumor > 4 cm, but <= 5 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_42630
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor > 5 cm but <= 7 cm in greatest dimension; or directly invading any of the following: parietal pleura (PL3), chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), phrenic nerve, parietal pericardium; or separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe as the primary

ListItem.name: LI_56528
ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor > 7 cm in greatest dimension; or tumor of any size invading one or more of the following: diaphragm, mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, recurrent laryngeal nerve, esophagus, vertebral body or carina; or separate tumor nodule(s) in an ipsilateral lobe different from that of the primary

ListItem.name: LI_1749
ListItem.title: pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

ListItem.name: LI_1750
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_1751
ListItem.title: pN1: Metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and / or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes, and intrapulmonary nodes including involvement by direct extension

ListItem.name: LI_1752
ListItem.title: pN2: Metastasis in ipsilateral mediastinal and / or subcarinal lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_1753
ListItem.title: pN3: Metastasis in contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_15998
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_15998_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39210
DisplayedItem.title: # Note: Most pleural (pericardial) effusions with lung cancer are a result of the tumor. In a few patients, however, multiple microscopic examinations of pleural (pericardial) fluid are negative for tumor, and the fluid is nonbloody and not an exudate. If these elements and clinical judgment dictate that the effusion is not related to the tumor, the effusion should be excluded as a staging descriptor.

ListItem.name: LI_47746
ListItem.title: pM1a: Separate tumor nodule(s) in contralateral lobe; tumor with pleural or pericardial nodules or malignant pleural (or pericardial) effusion#

ListItem.name: LI_47823
ListItem.title: pM1b: Single extrathoracic metastasis in a single organ (including involvement of a single nonregional node)

ListItem.name: LI_45951
ListItem.title: pM1c: Multiple extrathoracic metastases in single organ or in multiple organs

DisplayedItem.name: DI_30023
DisplayedItem.title: Note: For reporting cancer biomarker testing results, the CAP Lung Biomarker Template should be used. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
